definition: to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The quiet ones always sneak up on you.
sentences.chinese: 有些人總是不鳴則已一鳴驚人。

definition: variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to take a screen test/to audition/screen test/audition/tryout
Brooklyn, borough of New York City
Grammy Award (US prize for music recording)/also written 葛萊美獎|葛莱美奖
